subject.normal: TSVN 1.5.5 shows a strange folder in freshly created repository

body.para:
The URL as shown in Windows explorer is - \\filesrv\xxx\yyy\zzz\AllwynD \test The URL as shown in TSVN 1.5.5 Repo Browser is -
file:////filesrv/xxx/yyy/zzz/AllwynD/test where xxx, yyy and zzz are plain English Aphabets A to Z (and no special characters at all. Not even a space).
The folder name in this case is test.
As per the problem mentioned, I can see a folder named "t" in the repository browser.
This problem does not arise when I use a mapped drive to the test folder above. It happens only when I use the servername in the URL.
Please note - I am not manually entering the URL. I just browse to the folder and use the shell extension for TortoiseSVN / Repo-browser.
I do not how to send across the screenshot. I will mail the same to you on your Gmail ID.
Its a privilege to get a reply from you.
On Dec 19, 7:51 pm, Stefan Kueng <tortoise...@gmail.com> wrote:

quote.quotepara: I recently installed TSVN 1.5.5. When I create a fresh repository in a folder named ABCDEFG, and then I right click within this folder and say "Tortoise SVN / Repo-Browser" I get to see a folder named "G" in the repository.
If I make any changes to the repository like import,commit etc. I am unable to delete this folder "G"

And if before making any changes to the repository, I simply click on the folderpath above this folder "G" in the sidebar, the folder "G" dissappers. But when I again open the repository the folder "G" appears again.
What is the solution to this problem?
* what's the url to your repository? * is the name of the folder *really* ABCDEFG? If not, what's it called *exactly*? * screenshot?
-- ___ oo // \\ "De Chelonian Mobile" (_,\/ \_/ \ TortoiseSVN \ \_/_\_/> The coolest Interface to (Sub)Version Control /_/ \_\ http://tortoisesvn.net
